channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3799] Google Images: Spot the difference [Pic]
[+2581] Go Kitty! You Can Make It
[+2248] Mininova Deletes All Infringing Torrents and Goes "Legal"
item.description: Mininova, the largest torrent site on the Internet, has removed all torrents except those that were uploaded through its content distribution service. Mininova’s founders took the drastic decision after they lost a civil dispute against Dutch anti-piracy outfit BREIN, and were ordered to remove all infringing torrents from the site.

item.title: [+1439] World's Tallest Model Almost 7 Feet Tall (Surreal Pics)
[+1019] Yuck! Tastes Like Ass!
item.description: You won't believe what this dog is licking -- and he's happy about it.

item.title: [+970] The 6 Most Horrific Lessons Ever Taught in Elementary School
item.description: Irresponsible or downright crazy teachers wind up teaching our kids lessons we'd rather they'd kept to themselves

item.title: [+816] Evolution of Storage
item.description: Evolution of storage for music, photos and data. [infographic]

item.title: [+777] 61 Free Apps We're Most Thankful For
item.description: As we prepare to stuff our faces with a bountiful Thanksgiving feast, we turn our Thanksgiving spirit to the gobs of free software we love to say thank you to the developers, and to give our computers a feast of their own.

item.title: [+740] Allen Iverson Retires from the NBA
item.description: Allen Iverson has decided to retire from the NBA. His career is over, and what a career it was

item.title: [+707] Dog Works The Pharmacy Department [PICS]
item.description: Seriously, this isn’t a joke. It all started one day five months ago when Mansour decided to bring his dog to work. He didn’t think much of it at the time — he just wanted to have his best friend with him while he worked the sometimes slow, and occasionally, dangerous, early morning shift. The dog was given free rein of the store and a shirt.

item.title: [+700] 1936 Thanksgiving Camel Ad: Smoke After Each Course!
item.description: This advertisement for Camel cigarettes appeared in the November 23, 1936 edition of LIFE magazine. It earnestly demands that you smoke a Camel after each course of Thanksgiving dinner -- "for digestion's sake."

item.title: [+670] Black Friday Anti-Deals: What Not To Buy
item.description: Black Friday may when prices are low, but if you've carefully read the list of deals, you can tell it's also a BS marketing gimmick. Here's how not to get fooled (plus, what gadgets to avoid at any price):

item.title: [+660] This Computer Gave Birth to the Internet [Video]
item.description: It’s hard to appreciate that this mess of pipes that’s turned all of us into nerds that ogle over videos about the birth of the internet and allowed us to look at the menu before we get to the restaurant all began with a modest hook-up between two computers, one in UCLA, the other at Stanford University.

item.title: [+536] HP R2-D2 [Comic]

[+496] The Many Faces of Space Invaders (PIC)
[+449] Sesame Street Unveils New "Spill O'Reilly" Character
item.description: "Buy my new book, 'A Stinky Rotten Pile of Grouchiness.'"

item.title: [+429] Muslim teachers and students reject Darwin
item.description: In countries such as Egypt and Pakistan academics are, under conservative influence, rejecting evolution, a physicist warns.

item.title: [+413] Teeth-Whitening Company Sues Google, Microsoft, Yahoo, ...
item.description: A dental whitening company that admittedly used deceptive ad campaigns to trick users into signing up for expensive subscriptions is now suing Google, Yahoo, Microsoft and others

item.title: [+400] World's Largest Multi-Touch Wall is 4574 ft², 34M Pixels
item.description: The two-piece wall consists of a huge LED media facade (at the top), and a multitouch information-wall (at the bottom), and impresses by its physical size, as it equaling more than 6000 computer displays.
